intro: Haplopappus niveus, commonly known as the whiteleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has basal leaves that are covered in fine hairs and produces small, fluffy seeds in its composite flower heads. Haplopappus niveus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
